intro: Chamaesyce linearifolia var. nallamalayana, commonly known as the Nallamalayana sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure. The plant features small, green, ovate leaves with a smooth surface and produces clusters of yellowish-green flowers. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and is often found in coastal and dry inland regions. Due to its hardy nature, it is occasionally cultivated as an ornamental plant in arid landscapes.
